sections.instructions: Questions 11–14: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 15–20: Write the correct letter A–I.
sections.title: Local council report on traffic and highways / Recreation ground after proposed changes

questions.question: A survey found people's main concern about traffic in the area was
options: C changes in the type of traffic.

questions.question: Which change will shortly be made to the cycle path next to the river?
Plans for a pedestrian crossing have been postponed because
options: A the Post Office has moved.
B the proposed location is unsafe.
C funding is not available at present.

questions.question: On Station Road, notices have been erected
options: A telling cyclists not to leave their bikes outside the station ticket office.
B asking motorists to switch off engines when waiting at the level crossing.
C warning pedestrians to leave enough time when crossing the railway line.

sections.instructions: Questions 21–24: Choose TWO letters A–E. Questions 25–30: Choose SIX letters A–G.
sections.title: City bike-sharing schemes

questions.question: Which TWO benefits of city bike-sharing schemes do the students agree are the most important?
Which TWO things do the students think are necessary for successful bike-sharing schemes?
options: A Bikes should have a GPS system.
B The app should be easy to use.
C Public awareness should be raised.
D Only one scheme should be available.
E There should be a large network of cycle lanes.

sections.instructions: Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.
sections.title: The extinction of the dodo bird

questions.question: Portuguese ships transporting ____ stopped at the island.
The Dutch established a ____ on the island.
A Dutch painting suggests the dodo was very ____.
The only remaining soft tissue is a dried ____.
Recent studies suggest the birds were capable of rapid ____.
They were able to use their small wings to maintain ____.
Their ____ was of average size.
Their sense of ____ enabled them to find food.
____ also escaped onto the island and ate the birds' eggs.
The arrival of farming meant the ____ was destroyed.
